Author: meowsaysdexter

Comment: Then the government probably should've done a better job at convincing the average person that freedom can be obtained by all without sacrificing the prosperity of the individual.  Notice how the greatest progressive achievements such as the civil rights, happened during periods of prosperity and growth?  If the DNC is unable to address the reality of what drives people to this "privileged" ideology, they are going to lose 2028, or 2032, whichever, and we'll be back here, at step one, wondering how, when the answer is really simple. The people who didn't vote, or who voted Trump, believe to some extent that freedom for everyone means marginal improvements to their individual prosperity, and freedom for the select few (see: America First ideas) means significant improvements to their individual prosperity.  DNC needs to figure out how to convince people that it's possible to significantly improve lives of *everyone*, but so far they've only offered small improvements that don't effect the majority.  Yea the DNC could only make small improvements because they get interference from the GOP, but that only means they can't effectively fight the other side.
Author: Naticbee
